15.62. Given an ordinary irreducible character χ of a finite group G write ep(χ) to denote the p-part of χ(1) and put ep(G) = max{ep(χ) | χ ∈ Irr(G)}. Suppose that P is a Sylow p-subgroup of a group G. Is it true that ep(P) is bounded above by a function of ep(G)?
Comment of 2005: An affirmative answer in the case of solvable groups has been given in (A. Moret´o, T. R. Wolf, Adv. Math., 184 (2004), 18–36).
A. Moret´o
answer: Yes, it is true (Yong Yang, Guohua Qian, Adv. Math., 328 (2018), 356–366).
